info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 12 at 2:47PM MST until September 12 at 4:45PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR KINGMAN WITH AREAS FROM AIRWAY ROAD TO STOCKTON HILL ROAD AND ALL LOCATIONS TO THE EAST RECEIVING THE MOST INTENSE RAINFALL. THIS FLASH FLOODING IS ONGOING AND ADDITINAL HEAVY RAINFALL IS EXPECTED. THIS IS A PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. ... ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHWESTERN MOHAVE COUNTY... At 247 PM MST, Emergency management significant flooding in the Kingman area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Kingman with areas from Airway Road to Stockton Hill Road and all locations to the east receiving the most intense rainfall. This flash flooding is ongoing and additinal heavy rainfall is expected. This is a particularly dangerous situation. . This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kingman and New Kingman-Butler. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
